title: Substitution
text: Substitute the $$x-$$ and $$y-$$ values into the equation to check if the ordered pair is a solution to the equation.
speech: Substitute the , x minus  and  y minus  values into the equation to check if the ordered pair is a solution to the equation.
pacedSpeech: values into the equation to check if the ordered pair is a solution to the equation.

title: Application
text: Substitute $$y$$ for $$0$$ and $$x$$ for $$-6$$. Are $$0$$ and 1/3(-6)+2 equal? If so, the ordered pair is a solution. If not, the ordered pair is not a solution.
speech: Substitute  y  for  0  and  x  for  negative 6 . Are  0  and 1/3(-6)+2 equal? If so, the ordered pair is a solution. If not, the ordered pair is not a solution.
pacedSpeech: and 1/3(-6)+2 equal? If so, the ordered pair is a solution. If not, the ordered pair is not a solution.
